{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine the direct content of the cavernous sinus, we need to review the relevant documents that discuss the anatomy of the cavernous sinus. Document [27] also mentions that the structures involved in cavernous sinus syndrome include the abducens nerve, the internal carotid artery, and the sympathetic plexus. Based on this information, we can conclude that the direct content of the cavernous sinus includes the oculomotor nerve, trochlear nerve, abducent nerve, and ophthalmic division of the trigeminal nerve.
